qas.question: How did the Japanese refer to the atomic bombings and the Soviet invasion?
What was the one condition Japan wanted before accepting the Potsdam terms?

answers.text: "prerogative of His Majesty as a Sovereign Ruler"

qas.question: What was the reply to Japan about the surrender condition?

answers.text: "authority" of the emperor "shall be subject to the Supreme Commander of the Allied Powers"

qas.question: What was it called when the Japanese Cabinet accepted the Potsdam terms?

context: The effects of the <a0_0>"Twin Shocks"<a0_0/>—the Soviet entry and the atomic bombing—were profound. On 10 August the <a4_0>"sacred decision"<a4_0/> was made by Japanese Cabinet to accept the Potsdam terms on one condition: the <a2_0>"prerogative of His Majesty as a Sovereign Ruler"<a2_0/>. At noon on <a1_0>15 August<a1_0/>, after the American government's intentionally ambiguous reply, stating that the <a3_0>"authority" of the emperor "shall be subject to the Supreme Commander of the Allied Powers"<a3_0/>, the Emperor broadcast to the nation and to the world at large the rescript of surrender, ending the Second World War.
